titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alice Pohlman Attwaters student materials
titlestmt.author: Jenny Johnson

publicationstmt.publisher: Dept. of Special Collections & University Archives.
publicationstmt.p: Copyright Â© 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Dept. of Special Collections & University Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94305-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/spc/using-collections/permission-publish.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Alice Pohlman Attwaters student materials (SC1231). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

processinfo.head: Processing Notes
processinfo.p: Original materials were scanned January 12, 2015 and returned to donor as part of donor agreement.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Alice Pohlman Attwaters earned an AB in Psychology from Stanford in 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are materials from Attwater's Overseas Studies experience as part of Stanford in Austria XIII, including photographs, itineraries, and an FAQ document for students. These materials also include the 1971 "Big Red Rose Bowl" program produced by KZSU.

did.unittitle: Big Red Rose Bowl program produced by KZSU
